comments:
Add breakpoint to NavigatorDropAdapter.openError.
Create a simple project in the navigator.
Create a file in this project.
Drag the file and drop over the project.
In NavigatorDropAdapter.openError select IStatus.ERROR and Display it.

Got the following exception:

Which build did this happen on? Can you reproduce this problem with a simpler
test case?

We've tried reproducing it with a simple class that declares a protected method,
debugging to the method, and then evaluating a public static final int. This works.

Just reproduced it in the 20020411 build.
I added the breakpoint to the line:
          if (!status.isMultiStatus()) {
All projects in my workspace are binary projects except org.eclipse.ui which I 
have from CVS.

Just happened to me in 20020416. IBM 1.3

I had a breakpoint in
org.eclipse.jdt.ui.internal.browsing.JavaElementContentProvider.processDelta

When the breakpoint was hit I selected a a stack frame below the current. The
value for "flags" was ok in the Variables view but when I hovered over "flags"
it said the value is 0. I then selected "flags" and inspected it. ==> boom.

The problem here is that there is no public class declared here. Our evaluation 
source generator currently relies on the existance of a public class in the 
compilation unit.

Fixed in SourceBasedSourceGenerator.

If no public type is found, the compilation unit passed into JDT Core will have
a default name ("Eval").

Please verify.

Btw, nice find, Eduardo.
*** Bug 14118 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
